Class BoardView

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.BoardView
public class BoardView extends Object
Small helper that owns board rendering/layout concerns extracted from GuiController. This is a focused, low-risk extraction: it mirrors the existing behaviour but encapsulates the grid, ghost, and coordinate math so the controller can delegate to it.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardView

      public BoardView(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.Pane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.Pane ghostPanel, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas bgCanvas)

  • Method Details

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initialize the visual board representation from a board matrix and an optional initial ViewData describing the active piece. This will create the grid cells, brick nodes and ghost nodes and schedule a layout pass on the JavaFX Application Thread.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the board matrix (rows x cols) used to build the grid
      brick - optional snapshot of the active piece; may be null

    • boardToPixel

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D boardToPixel(int boardX, int boardY)

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)

    • mapCodeToPaint

      public static javafx.scene.paint.Paint mapCodeToPaint(int i)
      Map a numeric board color code to a Paint instance. Public so other controllers can reuse the canonical mapping and avoid duplication.

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)

    • updateGhost

      public void updateGhost(ViewData brick, int[][] boardMatrix)

    • getCellWidth

      public double getCellWidth()
      Returns:
      measured cell width in pixels (may be recomputed after layout).

    • getCellHeight

      public double getCellHeight()
      Returns:
      measured cell height in pixels (may be recomputed after layout).

    • getBaseOffsetX

      public double getBaseOffsetX()
      Returns:
      measured base X offset (scene pixels) of the grid origin.

    • getBaseOffsetY

      public double getBaseOffsetY()
      Returns:
      measured base Y offset (scene pixels) of the grid origin.

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Returns:
      number of columns in the visible grid (defaults to 10 when unknown)

    • getCellFill

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint getCellFill(int boardRow, int boardCol)
      Safely obtain the paint used to fill a specific board cell. Returns Color.TRANSPARENT when the cell is not available or uninitialized.
      Parameters:
      boardRow - row index in the display matrix
      boardCol - column index in the display matrix
      Returns:
      the Paint used to fill the cell

    • boardCellScenePoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D boardCellScenePoint(int boardX, int boardY)
      Returns the scene coordinates of the top-left corner of the given board cell. If an actual display Rectangle is available it's used for exact positioning, otherwise falls back to converting the computed boardToPixel point via the gamePanel.
      Parameters:
      boardX - column index
      boardY - row index
      Returns:
      scene coordinates of the top-left corner of the cell
